page.title: 14Changing Times
page.content: The area of Old Warden and Ickwell is mainly agricultural. Most of the changes are connected with the advance of agriculture. The many cottages built for farm labourers are now often privately owned. Indeed the nature of the villages has made them most sought after because of their rural charm. Some local houses date back 500 years and there are examples of thatched, wooden and brick buildings. There are three very large estates and families from these feature in local history. Old Warden is mostly the creation of two families, the Ongley's and the Shuttleworth's. Today the Shuttleworth Estate is home partly for the Shuttleworth Collection of historical aeroplanes, cars and bikes, and partly an agricultural college.
